Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: gvillelovers
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights with my husband and 17 year old daughter. Stayed on the 4th floor in a studio facing the courtyard on the second floor. Stayed in a queen bed and had a sofa that made a great single bed. Very adequate and quaint. Grocery store near Pigialle, CarreFour, was great for breakfast food. Could make our own coffee in the morning and pastries from the backery were great. View from the fourth floor was great. Were only two blocks from the Sacre Couer. I highly recommend spending the 6 euros to walk up to the Dome. That is, if you do not mind climbing 10 flights of stairs. The view of Paris was phenominal. Montremart is a great location in the city with lots of bistros nearby. Place near the Sacre Couer and the artist square was great. Staff was friendly and accomodating. The internet is very spotty though. Don't count on getting and staying on it. I would definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good No Frills Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: forevervacationing
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for almost 2 weeks. Nice Location. Rooms are little small but usual for business hotel in downtown. Located near Metro Station. Cooperative Staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lots of space!”
Reviews.Author: Hectorshouse09
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our two children ( 11 and 14) - we couldn't believe how much space we had - a large living room, with a dining table and two sofa beds for the children, then a separate kitchen ( with another table) and a separate double bedroom for us ( and the bathroom of course). One room overlooked the lovely courtyard garden space ( a bit cold to use in Feb) and one room overlooked the quiet street. Having the kitchen was great - we made our own breakfasts, ( sourced from the local awardwinning bakery), and a couple of good evening meals ( dishwasher to deal with pots). Cleaning is done at the end of your stay, but this was not a problem at all. The location is lovely - about 5 mins from Metro and Sacre Coeur ( we walked from Gare du Nord after arriving on Eurostar - 20 mins I think). There are lots of lovely bars and bistros - and a really pretty theatre on the corner - we saw John Malkovich stood outside - he's directing the next production there I think)! Would definitely recommend for families.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Yomna S Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: +ve: the hotel has very nice and helpful staff, the location of the hotel is a few minutes walk from a metro station that you can get you any where in paris in addition to be a few minutes walk to the sacre coeur. The kitchen in the room is very well equipped with all you need to cook with. -ve : there is a free wifi but i was told if i need a high speed internet i have to pay for it however i paid and still the connection was very bad. Cleaning of the room is not included in the package and you have to pay for it if u need them to clean the room for you.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recomend to go with young children”
Reviews.Author: Selena07
Reviews.Content: We went with Our 7 months son and were unhappy with hotel - had room in 2 floor and lift was very small so we couldn't fitt with buggy. Rooms wasn't in best condition (we had 1 bed apartment) and as we were told cleaning isn't included in the price, no tea&coffee every day as you normaly would get in hotel. We needed to take our own rubish becouse no one did it for us. Free wi-fi is imposible - if you want to browse internet you will need to pay because with free one you just can't do anything - not even check weather or bus. Last day when we were leaving lift was out of order so we needed to take all our things from 2 floor to 0 and then take another lift to go to parking zone. I would never go in that hotel again. Oh and one more thing - from all stuff there was only o e women who could speack english - others tryed but you could bearely understand them.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic weekend”
Reviews.Author: CoolPilot
Reviews.Content: Adagio Paris Montmartre is nice apartments in the heart of Paris- on the Montmartre and near Sacre Coeur. It is not usual hotel room, but very small flat with all necessary furniture and technical devises to live. There is no cleaning (so please be prepared to clean yourself and to separate paper trash from glass). Our windows went to small street, so it was quite in nights regardless Montmartre is busy and load area with lots of tourists. Cooking and eating near with the open window we felt so happy to enjoy atmosphere of Paris. I would recommend this hotel to young people who like special accommodation, not a typical standards of chain brand hotels. There are many restaurants and shops around, so you will never have problem with meal there.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: wards
Reviews.Content: The apartments were spotless the staff so friendly and helpful. We had two apartments meant for six people and they were fairly spacious a bit cosy for 6 adults but could be done. Plenty of choice of bars cafes bakeries and little boutique shops just a stones throw away. As everyone else has said the location is amazing so close to the easy to use Metro system. Just one word of warning the metro tickets are used for one journey only although the machine does give it back at the end of the journey and you end up with a pocketful of tickets!!! My daughter in law was pulled up in a random ticket check she had so many tickets she could not find the right one straight away and they said they would call the police the situation was very aggressive but got sorted in the end!!

Reviews.Title: “Great way to do Paris”
Reviews.Author: Philip_Lee
Reviews.Content: So after a last minute forced rebooking, I checked into this place after browsing the reviews here. I must say this is a pleasant surprise. A serviced appartment allows the freedom to roam the city and when you don't feel like eating out anymore, return for a simple home cooked meal. Abbesses, Pigalle and Anvers Metros are a short walk away. Gare du Nord is also only a 10-15 minute walk up Rue Dunkerque. Plus you're minutes away from the Basillica Sacre Coeur. Definitely recommend

Reviews.Title: “Excellent if you like Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location if you like the tourist trap Montmartre, but it´s very close to the Metro to reach other parts of Paris. The kitchenette very practical but the shops close to the hotel is very expensive. It´s better to shop at the Carrefour supermarket close to Pigalle Metro.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY APARTMENT”
Reviews.Author: cgfromperth
Reviews.Content: We loved this place, travelled with my daughter and friend and stayed 4 nights. So close to Metro and Sacre Coeur. Lots of shops and restaraunts everywhere. Only problem was a the triple room had a double bed and 1 single. We found this a lot in Europe. Fortunately I was with my daughter so I could sleep with her. Other than that the apartment was beautiful, bathroom was huge , lovely toiletries and the staff was exceptional. they were very helpful. Entrance to the hotel is lovely. No breakfast but kitchen in the apartment so we could make ourselves at home which was great. Free wifi, heated towel rail, comfortable beds couldnt ask for anything else. Very nice apartment would definately stay again. Staff deserve a raise they were fantastic. Note: the lift is very tiny 2 people only can fit in with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KK_75
Reviews.Content: We had a nice studio apartment, loved the area, loved the hotel, didn't have much dealings with the staff there but the room was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great value.”
Reviews.Author: ShazC1970
Reviews.Content: Just a short walk from the Metro, easy to find in a bustling area very near to The Sacre Cure. We had a family room for my 2 children, my husband and me. It had sofa beds enough for 3 people in the main room and a single bed in a small room to the side,( they were comfortable with nice cean bedding). There was a balcony which could seat 2 comfotably with a table. The shower was lovely and powerful. The small kitchenette was well stocked, clean and in good working order. The view was atmospheric, looking over a small garden with tables and chairs which you could sit at at any time. The staff were very helpful. We had a small delay getting into our room, the staff were very apologetic and we got our 1st breakfast ( worth 40 euros ) on the house because of this. The staff spoke good English, but did let you try out the French language if you tried! I would definately recommend this hotel and would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room for a family holiday”
Reviews.Author: famonhols
Reviews.Content: We had a two bedroom apartment with Kitchenette. The rooms were clean. The kitchen included a dishwasher and large fridge. The living room featured a large dining table which was great (as a family of 5) to sit and eat together. However, the hotel is located in a seedy area of Paris and not necessarliy appropriate for families. Be aware of all the extras. Room cleaning and fresh towels are additional costs. The hotel also charged a per person fee for booking at Disneyland BUT Just 5 minutes walk away there is a tourist information centre who can sell Disneyland tickets with no additional costs or fees.

Reviews.Title: “our four night stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Montmartre in the apartment. It was in a good location and the sun streamed into the room in the morning. I found the kitchen to be conducive to cooking and we had a good night sleep. Our sixteen year old son enjoyed the wi fi connection.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but somewhat noisy”
Reviews.Author: bjorgk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Adagio Paris Montmartre in a triple room over a weekend. The hotel was mainly chosen for its location and price level. Service was overall good and the rooms adequate although noise carried from the street as well as from neighbouring rooms. If you're a sound sleeper I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel, if not you might consider bringing earplugs ;)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice surroundings, but very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Lost_Diplomat2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little bit difficult to find, at the end of an hallway, by a theatre. I arrived during the evening and I had to deal with the evening shift (central european expats). Very difficult to get twin beds (had to pay extra). Rooms are very small and definitely far from soundproof. Nice if you wish to stay for a long time and cook by yourself since the small kitchenette is well appointed. Please do not consider their breakfast if you are an early bird: no fresh bread/croissants before 9am, especially on weekends. If you really need to be in the middle of Montmartre, walking distance from Sacré Coeur, this is a good place to consider for a pic-nic or low budget trip to France. For my business trip, it was definitely a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong with this place”
Reviews.Author: VascoDeGama1963
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and 2 kids and thought it was fine. I cant believe all the negative reviews I have just read. We had 4 nights here and yes this is a "lively area" not unlike the quiter parts of Kings Cross or Carlton in Oz. There are a few drunks around at night but there are in Northbridge WA as well. Very well located close to transport and cafes etc. Make sure you have breakfast in any of the local bakeries. Let them know you arent English and things will be bettter for you. Pleasant staff who speak english , didnt incur any extra charges and it snowed in Paris ! I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Adagio Paris Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: gawab
Reviews.Content: very convenient, quiet, clean but a bit shabby (lighting, decoration, furniture). If you can dismiss it, then enjoy. Very friendly staff. Clean and spacious reception hall. Comfortable bathroom. A patio.

Reviews.Title: “great location BUT this dead end street is a punk (drunk) hang out”
Reviews.Author: carpedm
Reviews.Content: And there's more to tell. Promised internet connection failed to work, except at 5 in the morning....and although the price was inflated they were prepared to charge extra for every small request. Example: extra towels!!!! Equipment in the kitchenette...was inadequate, not even a coffee maker...and not so much as a sachet of sugar or a supply of bottled water. I have stayed in Paris, in this neighborhood, for the past five years, and was never so disappointed. I will NOT be back. I will not suggest this venue to anyone. The local dipso crowd uses the public street as a public pissing spot. And this in one of the potentially loveliest corners of an otherwise safe and charming neighborhood. Beware! Accor should make some changes. Their reputation suffers. The guests suffer. We certainly did. Incredible staff? yes. but not in a good way. NO Maps, no email, no fax, no knowledge of the neighborhood...no experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: GJMPerth
Reviews.Content: A great location making it easy to get around Paris and handy to lots of great little bars and restaurants. The room was small but it met our requirements. There is a little theatre at the front of the lane leading to the hotel and a lot of youths congregate around the area. It seemed safe and you don’t feel threatened as there are lots of shops, restaurants, and bars around, but the youths spend many hours there and urinate on the paths leading to the hotel so the smell of urine can be very strong, I’d hate to know what it would be like in the height of summer. If they could fix this it would be ideal. Also be warned that many of the restaurants in the area don’t accept credit or debit cards (cash only) so make sure you’re prepared. They are inexpensive but trying to find an ATM in the lanes of Montmartre at 11 at night can be difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Cute studio steps from Sacre Coeur and the Metro”
Reviews.Author: Nick_and_Michael
Reviews.Content: A nice little apartment-hotel in the Montmartre section of Paris. Pros: -Comfortable little studio with a well appointed kitchen allowing us to relax and live our normal routines on vacation -Comfortable bed -Free Internet -Friendly staff who spoke excellent English -Nice neighborhood with plenty of nearby markets and easy metro access -Lovely interior courtyard for use of guests Cons: -Internet service, although free, was spotty -The room locking mechanism was unusual (you had to lock yourself in with a key) which made me feel nervous in case of emergency -Services are extra if you are one who needs your bed made for you and clean towels every day

Reviews.Title: “Great for families, can be noisy on weekends”
Reviews.Author: Xnav
Reviews.Content: Location: On a little sidestreet off Blvd Rouchechart. We arrived by Eurostar at Gare du Nord, and since the taxi line was huge, we walked about 10-15 min to get here. Going back to Gare du Nord for the RER airport train, we took the Anvers metro (some stairs) back, with a bit of a walk from the connecting La Chapelle station. Convenient to 2 metro line stations (anvers and Abesses) about 5 min walks away. Plenty of restaurants in the neighborhood (do try the Pizza place just south of Blvd Rouchechart nr the Carrefour grocery store 1 -2 blocks west of here). Usually one transfer required to get to the main sites in Paris by metro. Never felt unsafe at night, neighborhood a little rougher than the rest of Paris (esp Barbes-Rouchechart metro station), which was my greatest fear, but we typically got back btwn 8-9 pm at night and never had a problem. Arrival: Staff very pleasant, on arrival and departure. Room: Clean modern design, great for a family with young kids. We went to the Carrefour about a block away to get items for breakfast. The hotel offering was a little too pricey for me (10 euros for some croissants, coffee, etc). We had a room overlooking the courtyard with a balcony which was very nice (called a studio for 4 persons). Beds were made out of sofa beds (4 individuals). In room safe (which we could not get to work), and also a safety box at the reception area. Only problem was the lack of air conditioning, the room can get a little stuffy with the windows closed. Do bring salt and pepper and sugar, but all pots/pans and utensils provided. On friday/sat night, could hear music from a nearby club, which was the only drawback of the location. One night people were laughing and living it up at the courtyard or nearby restaurant as well. No traffic noise, however. Amenities: Nice little garden in the courtyard. Overall, very pleasant stay. Just beware of the noise on weekend nights if you are a light sleeper. Location in Paris a little further than more central hotels, but finding a room for 4 is very difficult in my opinion, and this was perfect for us, and convenient to nearby transportation. In room kitchen very convenient for those with young kids.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not so keen on the location”
Reviews.Author: Gemma129
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with GREAT staff, however the location/ Montmartre in general was not somewhere i would stay again, I did not feel safe walking around after sunset. The walls in the room were thin (i have read lots of reviews of other hotels and have found this to be the case throughout Paris) and we could hear everything, and i mean everything, our neirbours were doing. The hotel was good value for the money and anyone on a budget i would recommend this hotel too however if you can it would be worth it to spend abit more and stay in a nicer location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Smartpals
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is awesome. If you get to stay on higher floors, the view is too good out of the window. Receptionists are very kind and gentle too. The service is nice. Overall I would like to rate 8.5/10

Reviews.Title: “Loved it :)”
Reviews.Author: AndiJ_AJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon for more than a month and it was brillant. The room was a cute little apartment, the staff couldnt do enough for us. It was spacious, clean, quiet and they provided a welcome pack of goodies for use in the kitchen and bathroom. Just wonderful :) Two minutes walk from Sacre Couer, we made it our neighbourhood and think very fondly of it :) Loved it, loved it, loved it. You are close to all amenties, two supermarkets and a laundry, post office, honestly everything you need is within walking distance, Metro too!

Reviews.Title: “We would go there again!”
Reviews.Author: genoli
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to this hotel for our honeymoon and were very pleased. First, it is a very quiet location with no trafic around. The room was very nice (we had a studio for 2) with a little kitchenette that was very useful. Plates, glasses, towels, sheets are included and everything is clean when you arrive. Since it is a studio, they don't clean the room everyday, wich was fine for us. The staff was very nice and helpful and gave us tips about what to visit in the area. The only negative comment we have is that the rooms are not soundproof, so we can hear what's going on in other rooms! In Paris, almost every hotel is like this, so we knew that it would be that way and it was not that bothering for us. The hotel is near a metro station and the neighborhood is really safe. It is a nice place to bring your family. Definitely, our experience has been very nice and we would go back again anytime!

Reviews.Title: “OK apartment but our was dirty”
Reviews.Author: PRB_Manly
Reviews.Content: wife i & 3 kids had 5 nites here over Xmas. Main issue was that the floor was filthy when we arrived - was cleaned after we complained. Otherwise OK. Street outside was grubby but this appears to be standard for Paris. Close to underground stations so good location. Staff helpful in that french way!! Laundromat just around the corner - big thing for us on 5 wk tour of Europe - they weren't always easy to find. Also supermarket, baker etc all nearby. Very expensive compared to hotel we had stayed at (and they included breakfast) but t was Xmas and in Paris so maybe thats the norm.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Andariego
Reviews.Content: Location and price are always a struggle in Paris. This apart-hotel does an excellent job in both categories. The room are spacious, well equipped and modern. Our apartment faced and interior garden so it was quiet. The staff was very helpful, always present and cheerful. My only grip was the lack of a lamp in the kitchen area. We couldn't park at the building (just 5 places) but the staff directed us to a nearby (50 mts) public parking, and oddly the tariff was a bit lower!!! (€22/day) We certainly enjoyed the stay. Ah, do not expect 100+ channels on the TV, just the 4-5 french TV air stations but, Who watches TV while in Paris?

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Loll
Reviews.Content: This aparthotel is in Montmartre near the Anvers Metro at the base of the Sacre Coeur. We stayed for three nights in a studio which had twin beds, full bathroom, kitchenette (sink, dishwasher, fridge, hot plates, microwave etc). Pluses Good location - short walk to metro and plenty of restaurants and bars. Mini supermarket next door. Spotlessly clean. Nice size room and bathroom. Pleasant friendly and helpful staff. Comfortable beds (except pillows). Having our own kitchenette (once the hot plates worked) was very useful for breakfast. Much cheaper and better to make your own hot drinks and pop to the local boulangerie for breakfast croissants and bread. Minuses We had a problem with the electricity - the hot plates kept blowing the sockets in the room. This wasn't solved until the next day - however the person on duty did try everything to solve the problem but as the hotel was full we couldn't be moved. Once fixed all was fine. Sound proofing in the room was not good - we could hear EVERYTHING in the next room. Pillows - you only get one very flat pillow - we asked every day for extra pillows but they never arrived. I would stay here again for a short break - but probably not for a whole week.

Reviews.Title: “Not some where I would stay or recommend.”
Reviews.Author: unhappyjan
Reviews.Content: We booked our accommodation through a travel agent and they informed us on booking that we had booked one of the biggest rooms that they offer. We are a family of 5, children aged 12, 10 & 6. We had an appartment that slept 6. On our arrival we were very impressed with the look of the hotel in and out side, very modern. After booking in went to our room on the second floor. Upon opening the door a stale musty smell came from our appartment. The rooms were very small, so small that when standing in the kids bunk room you were able to have one shoulder touching the bunk bed and the other touching the wall. You basically had to step into the bath to close the bathroom door. The kitchen was roomy but no bench space, no kettle to boil water, no toaster, no washing liquid, no cloth to wipe down table. With having 5 people in a 6 bed appartment I would have expected that we all had beds, except our 12 year old had to sleep on a rollaway on the floor in the lounge room. Overall the service from the reception was rude and not acceptable. No one every around to get any information. We would not recommend these appartments to anyone who has a family. It is very central to everything and has a shuttle bus that pulls up the front to take you to Euro Disney. This is good value.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our studio with kitchen in Monmartre”
Reviews.Author: A swedish family
Reviews.Content: Stayed with the family at this place and were satisfied that it gave us what was described on the internet. The studio was clean and no bugs to be found not even in the waste room in the corridor, which was kept very clean. One has to remember that you have a nicely equipped kitchen (saves a lot of money for a family) in the studio. There is a nice grocery store close to the residendence the chain is called Champion and have everything you need. Buy your breakfast there and your bread at the bakery close to the place. The Metro station Anvers is a few minutes away from the place it will take you to the Eiffel tower in about 15 minutes not counting the transfer. The studio was facing the street with a lower Paris noise than I have experienced in hotels in the center with its large boulevards and heavy traffic round the clock. If you close the window you will be OK until the waste truck comes along the street. If you want a quite room you should book an apartment facing the lovely inner garden (but then you miss out on spying on the Parisian life outside) The staff helped us in all our questions and we had nothing negative to say about them. In short we enjoyed our little parisian apartement and its location and would recommend it to others, especially as Paris hotels can be very noisy. Finally we saw nothing of the sex industri people mention when talking about Montmartre (Clichy). The area have a lot of nice resturants and shops close so you will enjoy an evening stroll with the children to the Sacre Couer a few minutes (and stairs) away.

Reviews.Title: “Mmmmmm”
Reviews.Author: PatricitaPepa
Reviews.Content: Beware this is not a hotel, this is a time-share appt. you dont get ANY service, no cleaning, no changing towels, nothing but a french reception lady, very selfish and absolutely helpless. BUT you get a fully equipped kitchen , that makes you earn some money,and you have almost 30 sq. mts so you are more confortable. The location is good, 2 o 3 blocks from the Sacre Coeur church, restaurants, food stores, but could be better. You are 1 block from Bvd. Clichy, that is not the best place at night. The you have metro and very buses.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: JacovT
Reviews.Content: After reading some terrible reviews about budget accommodation in Paris on this site, we got to the Pierre & Vacances Residence, Montmartre a bit wary, expecting the worst. Fortunately our fears were unfounded. We booked a 2-bed studio for 3 nights, and found it very good value for money. The studio was clean, 2 beds, with a nice bathroom (toilet separate) and a reasonably well equipped kitchenette (fridge, coffee-maker, mini-oven, stove, pots, crockery for 4). Our windows opened on the Rue D’Orsel, a typical small Parisian cobbled (one-way) street, literally a stone throw away from the bottom of the Sacre-Coeur gardens. Unfortunately we had no grand view over the Sacre-Coeur, since we were on the second floor, but had intimate observation of the daily ebb- and flow of life on the street! We spend many a peaceful moment with a glass of wine spying on the neighborhood from our window. At night you could hear a car coming down the street for a mile, but by closing the double glazed windows, the noise is shut out effectively. The hotel is situated in the heart of the Montmarte area, with lots of small restaurants and interesting little shops on your doorstep. The nearest big supermarket is 1.5 blocks away on the busy Boulevard De Rochechouart, direction Pigalle. Various banks and ATMs are found 2 block to the south (Rue Lallier). The nearest Metro is the Anvers Metro Station, 1.5 blocks to the east. The Boulevard De Rochechouart is your gateway to the rest of Paris via the Open-top tourist busses, with a terminal (Sacre-Coeur) 1 block away from the hotel. This part of the Montmarte escapes the seedy sex-shops and characters found in the Pigalle area, 3 blocks further west. We did not try the optional breakfast offered by the hotel, but prepared most of our meals in the kitchenette. The small courtyard garden was really green and tranquil, perfect to have a morning coffee while planning the day’s activities. The staff were friendly and helpful, speaking enough English to be understood. The lifts were very small, but functional. On the downside: Nothing to report, but do not expect a 5-star hotel! If the typical Paris street noise bothers you at night, ask for a unit on the courtyard-side of the hotel. We would definitely return to the Pierre & Vacances Residence when we visit Paris again, because of the good value for money, and the excellent central position in Montmarte.

HotelInfo.Name: Adagio Paris Montmartre
HotelInfo.Address: 10 Place Charles Dullin, 75018 Paris, France
